intro: Sibbaldia californica, commonly known as California sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are basal, with a distinctive heart-shaped form and a hairy texture. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland valleys.
